Shokis are shepherds who lead wayward souls to the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15). **[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Shoki](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2421) **Source** [Pathfinder #186: Ghost King's Rage](/Sources.aspx?ID=189) pg. 82 **Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) 60 feet **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Requian](/Languages.aspx?ID=34); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Boneyard Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +19, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +20, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +20, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +20, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +16, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +19, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +16, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +14 **Str** +4 **Dex** +1 **Con** +4 **Int** +3 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +5 **Items** countless [religious symbol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=41), [Staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=12) --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +19 **Ref** +14 **Will** +21 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 130 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) **Resistances** [negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118) 10, [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) 10 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** staff +19 ([two-hand d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=198)), **Damage** 2d4+6 bludgeoning plus spirit touch **Divine Innate Spells** DC 28, attack +20 - **Cantrips (5th)** [Chill Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=35), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Disrupt Undead](/Spells.aspx?ID=79), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246), [Stabilize](/Spells.aspx?ID=307) - **2nd** [Calm Emotions](/Spells.aspx?ID=31), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will; self only) - **4th** [Read Omens](/Spells.aspx?ID=247), [Searing Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=269) (×3) - **5th** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (×3), [Mind Probe](/Spells.aspx?ID=193) - **6th** [Spirit Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=301) - **7th** [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) (self and locked soul only; to the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15) only) - **Constant (2nd)** [Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) - **Constant (5th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Infuse Staff** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) A shoki's staff becomes a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) staff_ and is treated as if it were [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374) while the shoki wields it. A shoki's staff has Hardness 14 and HP 56 (BT 28) while possessed by the shoki or Hardness 5 and HP 20 (BT 10) while out of the shoki's possession. A shoki whose staff is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work. **Soul Lock** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) **Requirements** The shoki doesn't have a soul locked within their staff; **Effect** The shoki attempts to capture the soul of a creature on the brink of death: either an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creature, a creature with the [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=11) condition, or a creature who died within the last minute. The target must attempt a DC 32 Will save with the following results.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock.
**Success** The shoki's staff tugs at the creature's soul but doesn't trap it. If the creature is living, it becomes [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9) (or increases its doomed condition by 1). If the creature is a corporeal undead, it becomes [enfeebled 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13). If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37). The creature then becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock for 24 hours.
**Failure** The shoki captures the creature's soul in its staff. If the creature is living, it dies. If the creature is a corporeal undead, its body becomes an inanimate corpse. While the soul is locked in the staff, the target can't be returned to life or undeath, or rejuvenate through any means, save for powerful magic, such as [_miracle_](/Spells.aspx?ID=196) or [_wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377). If the shoki's staff is destroyed or the shoki wills it, the soul is released. A shoki's staff can only hold one soul at a time. **Spirit Touch** A shoki's Strikes affect [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creatures with the effects of a [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) property rune and deal 2d6 negative damage to living creatures and 2d6 positive damage to undead.
Tools Of The Trade Shokis utilize numerous tools to aid them in their work, including religious symbols, magic, soul-trapping staves, and false empathy—though shokis spout impassioned speeches and play upon mortal emotions, they hold no compassion for the dead.
